entries.journal_entry_completion_summary: You were able to recover the data for the Incom corporation. Corporate spy contacts may not be as prestigious as government contacts, but they are far more lucrative.
entries.journal_entry_description: Without consistent and uniform government control, corporations are free to exercise any methods necessary to protect their intellectual property. When those efforts fail, there are even less restrictions on what options a corporation has available to it for recovery. Even an otherwise upstanding company like Incom is known to become ruthless when wronged.
entries.task00_comm_message_text: Sarlis isn't one of the best contacts we have, but when it comes to corporate jobs, he's pretty good.
entries.task01_journal_entry_description: Head to the location Sarlis gave you and take out some of the pirates. See if they have the datapad.
entries.task02_journal_entry_description: Talk to the pirate's leader and get the datapad from him.
entries.task03_journal_entry_description: Go to the Imperial oasis base and see if you can find the person who has the encrypted datapad. According to Eyan the target is a very capable fighter. Killing him may prove to be difficult, stealing the datapad may be your only option.
entries.task04_journal_entry_description: Steal the datapad and initiate a data integrity check on the datapad. This will confirm the information has not been copied, as well as alert Incom that you have the datapad.
entries.task04_journal_entry_title: Steal the Datapad and Check the Data on It
entries.task05_journal_entry_description: Return the datapad to your contact.
entries.task06_journal_entry_description: Good work. Incom has their technical data back.
entries.task08_comm_message_text: Good Work. My Incom contact has sent me confirmation of the data integrity. There are no copies of this data. Get the datapad back to me as soon as you can.
